{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with fatigue, joint pain, erythema with scaling on both cheeks, oral ulcers, and sparing of the nasolabial folds. These findings are consistent with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). SLE is an autoimmune disease that can affect multiple organ systems. One of the common laboratory findings in SLE is a decreased lymphocyte count due to lymphopenia. Therefore, the most likely finding in this patient would be a decreased lymphocyte count.", "answer_choice": "A"}
